bib.title: Multi-task Sequence Classification for Disjoint Tasks in Low-resource Languages
bib.author: Radom, Jarema and Koco{\'n}, Jan
bib.abstract: Multi-task learning (MTL) has been successfully utilized in numerous NLP tasks, including sequence labeling. In this work, we utilize three transformer-based models (XLM-R, HerBERT, mBERT) to improve recognition quality using MTL for selected low-resource language (Polish) and three disjoint sequence labeling tasks with different levels of inter-annotator agreement. Our best MTL model outperforms single-task models both within the tasks domain and overall performance.
